channel.title: Wild Thing adapted for multiple push-button switches
channel.description:
comprehensive online document with hardware list and instructions From Union College, NY Lam Son Ba Ngo, ECBE Department Professor Cherrice Traver, Project Supervisor Senior Capstone Project
Powered Mobility For Young Disabled Students Designed for the Kevin G. Langan School At the Center for Disability Services
https://cpb-us-w2.wpmucdn.com/muse.union.edu/dist/5/475/files/2018/03/LamNgoFinalReportPaper-1dj5wos.pdf

item.title: Wild Thing adapted for multiple push-button switches
item.dc:creator: Mattnauman
item.description:
Thank you for posting this. My 5th grade classes have built a wild thing based vehicle for a classmate, and recently received funding to build three more for classes in our district. This seat design really helped them with the problem of seating taller children!

Read full topic
item.source: Wild Thing adapted for multiple push-button switches

item.title: Wild Thing adapted for multiple push-button switches
item.dc:creator: jkauppil
item.description:
Great work, We have duplicated the Joystick version and found the need for switch options. This looks very doable. Thanks for your work.

Read full topic
